name: incrimination
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] the act or process of making someone seem guilty, especially of a crime: He destroyed the receipt to avoid incrimination. wrongful incriminations from DNA evidence
[ U ]
  law
  specialized in Scots law, a defence (= a way of arguing in court that you did not commit a crime) that consists of offering to show that someone else committed the crime: The accused lodged a special defence of incrimination which he later had to withdraw due to lack of evidence.
More examplesFewer examplesWe want to encourage whistleblowers to come forward and provide tips without incrimination. The story went from hilarity to incrimination.He invoked his right to avoid incrimination.a significant increase in the incrimination of traffickers
